weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a thick blanket of clouds hangs low in the sky, shrouding the city in a cool embrace that hints at the rain to come. The air is heavy with the scent of impending moisture, whispering of the wetness that will soon envelop the streets. With the temperature hovering around a brisk 58 degrees, an unsettling chill lingers, made more pronounced by a persistent south-southeast wind that sweeps through the city, carrying with it gusts that could rattle window panes and send loose leaves swirling in chaotic dances.

The day unfolds under a predominantly cloudy canopy, with a 70% chance of rain looming larger as the hours progress. By afternoon, the skies are likely to lower further, transforming the mellow morning light into a dreary dimness as the temperatures edge down to around 56. A transformation into a relentless rain is expected tonight, where conditions intensify into a 100% chance of downpour, drenching the streets with a possible accumulation of up to an inch, as the gusts may reach a fierce 55 mph, making a stroll less inviting and more treacherous.

This somber weather calls for layered clothing: a sturdy waterproof coat, perhaps a cozy sweater underneath, paired with dependable shoes to maneuver through puddles and slick sidewalks. It’s a perfect moment to seek refuge in a quaint local café, sipping a warm beverage while watching droplets race down the windows, or to lose oneself in the pages of a novel at home, as the world outside is momentarily muted by nature’s rhythmic symphony of rain. Engage with the comfort of indoor pursuits, from series binge-watching to savoring home-cooked meals—embracing the charm of a wet, wintry day in San Francisco.
